issue.title: test: Debug travis macOS environment
issue.body: A travis run for native macOS has recently been added, but it required a hacky `cd` workaround. Someone experienced with macOS on travis (or a lot of time) might want to debug this workaround and either remove it or document and wrap it. See https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/16597/files#r336052676 for context.

issue.title: Travis: run full test suite on native macOS
issue.body:
Adds an additional Travis machine to run the functional test suite on native macOS 

Homebrew is not particularly Travis compatible, but I found some useful hints here: https://discourse.brew.sh/t/best-practice-for-homebrew-on-travis-brew-update-is-5min-to-build-time/5215/11

issue.title: Travis CI bug in macOS environment #17178 workaround
issue.body:
According to #17178 by MarcoFalke, `cd` command (using for changing directory) has some conflicts with Travis builtin command with similar name in some environments (like macOS).

In this PR :
1. I tried to solve this issue by replacing `cd` by `type cd` in `ci/test/06_script_a.sh` and `ci/test/06_script_b.sh` .
2. I added function called `safe_cd` as commented in [here](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/16597/files#r336052676) to avoid duplication in code.

issue.title: build: update retry to current version
issue.body:
retry updated
REF: https://github.com/kadwanev/retry/commit/7d2caa94a7e54bd15f54fb7f2395e11b2b829575

While spell checking and linting a few typos showed up.
This commit eliminates those linting alerts.

REF: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17207

issue.title: ci: Make ci system read-only on the git work tree
issue.body:
Running the ci completely in a docker, without leaving any traces on the host system is not possible right now because the ccache and depends dir needs to be propagated back and picked up by the host for caching.

Fixes #17372

events.body: This can be fixed by upgrading rvm: See https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17202#issuecomment-545455404
I tried to upgrade RVM in 69612c4, but it seemed of no use: https://api.travis-ci.org/v3/job/615464864/log.txt

issue.title: ci: misc cleanups
issue.body:
Some minor cleanups:

* Remove unused and unmaintained extended_lint to avoid ci bottlenecks and waste of CPU
* Move all folders that hold temporary ci files to the ci scratch dir (except for the build dirs)
* Add some documentation to folders and remove the `BASE_BUILD_DIR` alias for the root directory
* Fixes #17178 by removing `cd`

events.body: Fixed this by removing `cd` from all ci scripts.
